intro: Echeandia formosa, commonly known as the showy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Echeandia in the family Onagraceae, which includes other evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while the stems are erect and branching. Echeandia formosa thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, typically growing in sandy or rocky soils.
